subject: Real Estate
title: Opportunity Zones: Tax Breaks for Development
description: A 60-second lesson on Opportunity Zones: Tax Breaks for Development.

hook.text: In 2017, the U.S. created 8,764 'Opportunity Zones' in low-income areas to attract investment.

buildup.text: Investors who put capital gains into these zones can reduce or even eliminate federal tax on those gains.

discovery.text: The program funneled over $75 billion into eligible areas within its first three years.

twist.text: Critics found much of the money went to luxury developments, not projects that helped existing residents.

climax.text: Opportunity Zones showed how tax incentives can attract money â€” but can't guarantee who benefits.

punchline.text: Tax breaks brought billions. The neighbors didn't benefit.

quiz.question: What is a criticism of Opportunity Zones?
options: Money went to luxury projects, not community needs
